marklogic.body: Forget the 'new art deco lamps', you can simply buy LED bulbs to replace your current incadescent, or - gasp - your CFL bulbs in your existing lamps with. Ranging from $8 to $25, these bulbs are only an Amazon away from your mailbox. For most home lighting, you want a 'warm white' bulb in the 2500-6000k light range, while bulbs in the 7000-9500k light range are 'painfully white-blue' in color (replacing an average 60-watt incadescent happens best around 3500k). By the way, LED's are the primary light you desire when you go -grid and use DC power from a bank recharged by solar panels or wind mills. LED bulbs are approximately 800% more efficient users of power than incandescent, and will reduce your power consumption by a factor of 8 (+/-). As a result, they will reduce your summer cooling expenses too, because they light-without-Heat. Most RV owners already know this - I refitted my RV with LED's and watched my DC Battery bank charge-lifespan increase almost 3-fold.
